description: This course provides an overview of the major thinkers who sought to create a science of
human society, the ideas they found fundamental to a science of society and how human
society changes through history. Classical thinkers such as Marx, Durkheim, Simmel,
Weber, and Mead are studied along with the schools of theory which they inspired:
positivism, interpretive and critical conflict theory.  Offered annually in the spring
semester. Prerequisite: one sociology/anthropology course. Open to sociology/anthropology
